thread.title: Man, 31, who never had a license lead police on pursuit and crashed.
thread.title_full: Man, 31, who never had a license lead police on pursuit and crashed. | News Local

author: Rebecca Parish
title: Man, 31, who never had a license lead police on pursuit and crashed.
text:
Police checks revealed the driver had never held a license. North Shore Man, 31, who “never held license” lead police on pursuit and crashed Rebecca Parish, North Shore Times February 10, 2017 9:37am
A man on bail who has never held a license led police on two pursuits through the north shore overnight, before crashing into a wall in Gordon.
The second pursuit ended around 3.30am when the unlicensed 31-year-old man lost control of the ute and crashed into a Bunnings store, causing three South-bound lanes to close because of debris.
Ku-ring-gai Local Area Command officers were on patrol on the Pacific Highway when they noticed the black Commodore which had allegedly been used in a short pursuit earlier that night.
The man from Speers Point was in the vehicle at a 7/11 fuel station in Lindfield as his 21-year-old passenger from Charlestown filled up the car.
Police allege the female passenger threw the fuel pump and got in the car, before the driver took off at speed after the police vehicle had pulled up behind it.
Officers pursued the vehicle, which reached speeds more than 50km above the speed limit, and it is alleged the driver overtook several other vehicles while heading North.
The man is said to have driven erratically, moving in and out of lanes and narrowly avoided colliding with another vehicle.
The driver then lost control and collided heavily with a road barrier at the intersection of St Johns Ave and Pacific Highway, before crashing into a Bunnings wall.
media_camera Serious damage was done to the business’ wall.
Police allege following the crash, which caused substantial damage to the Bunnings wall, the man and woman attempted to change seats.
The man was charged with leading a police pursuit, dangerous driving, driving recklessly or speeding or driving in a dangerous manner as well as charges relating to a person who has never held a license driving a vehicle on the road.
The male driver was refused bail in Hornsby Local Court today, and is due to attend Maitland Local Court on February 20.
Follow @Rebecca_Parish
